decks.notes: The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. It also includes cards like Solitude and Consign to Memory for removal and protection. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Wrath of the Skies and March of Otherworldly Light. Additionally, the deck includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Quantum Riddler to close out the game quickly. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive approach. By utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer provide additional value and resilience. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison can also disrupt the opponent's strategy, giving the deck an advantage in the match.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and utilizing the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber to repeatedly generate additional mana and cast powerful spells like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and landfall triggers. The deck also includes utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to search for key combo pieces and protect important spells from counter magic, creating a potent combo-based strategy that can quickly close out games.

The main concept of this Temur Aggro deck is to be fast and aggressive, with a focus on dealing damage quickly to overwhelm the opponent. This is achieved through a combination of low-cost creatures such as Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The deck also includes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Slickshot Show-Off to generate card advantage and maintain momentum. By combining efficient creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and close out the game swiftly.

The deck focuses on utilizing instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to quickly bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. Combining this with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation, the deck aims to efficiently control the game while setting up its combo pieces. The deck also includes various utility creatures like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler to provide additional card advantage and disruption. The manabase is optimized for consistency and flexibility, allowing the deck to smoothly execute its game plan.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Cards like Ephemerate and Consign to Memory provide utility and card advantage, while Teferi, Time Raveler and Spell Snare help control the tempo of the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy and enable the use of a variety of powerful spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost artifacts to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. By efficiently casting cards such as Kappa Cannoneer, Memnite, and Pinnacle Emissary, along with support from Engineered Explosives and Mishra's Bauble, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression. The inclusion of cards like Metallic Rebuke and Sink into Stupor allows for disruption and control options, while Urza's Saga provides additional value and consistency. The deck's synergy and speed make it a formidable Aggro-Affinity archetype in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on low-cost, aggressive creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent and win the game swiftly. By using cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Monastery Swiftspear, and Slickshot Show-Off, combined with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration provide card advantage, while Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge add extra damage potential. The deck also includes removal and disruption with Surgical Extraction and versatile lands to support the aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful threats like Primeval Titan and combo pieces such as Scapeshift. Using cards like Amulet of Vigor and Arboreal Grazer to accelerate, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to either overwhelm the opponent with creatures or win the game outright. The inclusion of Urza's Saga helps to tutor up key artifacts, while Boseiju, Who Endures and Crumbling Vestige provide additional ways to ensure spells resolve smoothly. Overall, the deck seeks to efficiently assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off the opponent's life total. The addition of cards like Blood Moon and Arena of Glory helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while providing additional benefits for your creatures. Overall, this deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and disruptive to secure a swift victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to play efficient creatures like Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge to clear the way for attacks. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride provide additional support and pump up your creatures for maximum damage. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt opponent's strategies. Overall, this deck aims to deal fast and consistent damage to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using creatures like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to generate massive amounts of mana and pressure opponents. By utilizing cards like Urza's Saga, Ancient Stirrings, and Devourer of Destiny, the deck aims to create a board state that overwhelms opponents with hard-hitting threats and disruptive plays. Emrakul, the Promised End serves as a powerful finisher, while Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble provide additional control and removal options to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck is designed to efficiently combo off and overwhelm opponents in the mid to late game.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost artifacts and creatures to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, along with efficient creatures like Memnite and Kappa Cannoneer, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on. Engineered Explosives and Sink into Stupor help control the opponent's board, while cards like Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast provide card advantage to keep the pressure on. The combination of artifact synergy and aggressive creatures make this deck a potent threat in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with low-cost creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, along with pump spells like Mutagenic Growth, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless offensive strategy. The inclusion of cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter provides additional versatility and threats to keep the pressure on the opponent. With efficient card draw options and versatile lands, this deck aims to close out games swiftly through aggressive tactics and efficient card choices.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively deploy threats early on using low-cost creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, while supporting them with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to clear the way. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration help with card advantage and digging for key cards. The goal is to pressure the opponent quickly and efficiently, using small boosts like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge to finish the game off before the opponent can stabilize. The mana base is streamlined for efficiency, with fetch lands and color fixing to ensure smooth gameplay.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through counterspells and removal spells while maintaining card advantage. The deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils to further control the opponent's resources. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Terminus to deal with threats. Overall, the goal of the deck is to control the game and outvalue the opponent through superior card advantage and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The key strategy is to build up a board presence with efficient creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while also using cards like Leyline Binding and Stubborn Denial to control the opponent's plays. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the multiple colors needed for the deck, with a mix of fetch lands and shock lands. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it until the opponent is defeated.

The deck focuses on ramping quickly with Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to get out Primeval Titan and combo off with multiple land triggers. The inclusion of Aftermath Analyst and Icetill Explorer provide additional card draw and ramp options. The deck also includes various utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Urza's Saga to support the combo pieces. Overall, the strategy is centered around utilizing lands and triggers efficiently to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and game-ending combos.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Amulet Titan combo by utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana and take extra turns with Primeval Titan. It also includes cards like Spelunking and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt opponents and protect the combo. The land base is built around utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to enhance the deck's overall strategy. The deck aims to ramp quickly and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats, ultimately leading to a fast and efficient victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures such as Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, supported by Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Ocelot Pride to quickly overwhelm opponents. Additionally, the deck includes burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to efficiently deal damage. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison disrupt opponents' strategies, while Seasoned Pyromancer and Voice of Victory provide card advantage. Overall, this deck aims to maintain a fast-paced aggressive strategy while controlling the board with a mix of creatures and spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing powerful cards like Ajani, Nactl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, the deck aims to deal consistent damage while controlling the board with cards like Goblin Bombardment and Blood Moon. The inclusion of cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Voice of Victory provide additional value and resilience to the deck. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for flexibility in a variety of matchups. Overall, the Boros Aggro deck is designed to be fast, efficient, and proactive in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Eldrazi Temple, Urza's Saga, and various lands to power out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End. It also utilizes cards like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to quickly generate tokens and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble helps control the board while also providing additional value. The overall goal is to create a fast and aggressive board state that can overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Eldrazi abilities to bring out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End. It also includes control elements like Malevolent Rumble and Devourer of Destiny to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The combination of fast mana ramp and powerful Eldrazi threats allows for the potential to overwhelm the opponent and maintain control of the game. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms provides additional board control and removal options.

The deck focuses on using ramp spells like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to quickly generate mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Devourer of Destiny. Cards like Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return provide removal and disruption, while Icetill Explorer and Sowing Mycospawn help control the board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its big threats while controlling the game with removal spells and land destruction. It combines control elements with Eldrazi creatures to create a powerful and synergistic gameplay experience.

The main concept of this Death and Taxes Aggro deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while aggressively attacking with a variety of creatures. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt your opponent's hand and strategy, combined with creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Solitude to apply pressure and control the board. The deck also includes cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp for additional versatility and responses to different threats. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to pressure opponents while disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. By combining efficient removal and versatile threats, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and close it out quickly. Additionally, cards like Ephemerate and Consign to Memory provide extra value by either protecting important creatures or generating card advantage. The land base is optimized for consistency and mana fixing, allowing for smooth gameplay and powerful plays.

This deck aims to disrupt opponent's plans by utilizing various removal spells and bouncing effects, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Phlage. Teferi, Time Raveler helps in controlling opponents' spells and allowing for efficient plays, while also enabling tempo swings with its bounce ability. Phelia and Consign to Memory offer additional support in disrupting opponents' strategies. The deck also includes some card draw and filtering with Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Quantum Riddler. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game and outvalue opponents while chipping away at their life total.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of powerful creatures, artifacts, and instant spells to quickly generate mana, disrupt opponents, and ultimately win through a combo involving Goblin Charbelcher. By running a landless strategy, the deck aims to maintain consistency and efficiency in executing its game plan. With access to countermagic and card draw, the deck can adapt to different matchups and ensure its combo can be successfully assembled and executed. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive spells like Sink into Stupor and Suppression Ray helps control the board and protect the combo from interference.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a wide array of artifacts, generating mana through cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, and utilizing Urza's Saga to search for key pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of artifact creatures, efficient spells like Metallic Rebuke, and disruption tools like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt. By leveraging the synergy between artifacts and sacrificing some life total for additional benefits, the deck aims to maintain a fast and aggressive tempo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck is focused on quickly assembling a board state with artifact creatures and utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga to generate card advantage. It aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt while also presenting threats with creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary. The deck's win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient card draw, using cards like Metallic Rebuke and Thoughtcast to maintain tempo and control the game.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with Birthing Ritual and using it to play a variety of creatures with powerful abilities. There is a mix of control elements with counter spells like Flare of Denial and removal like Dismember, as well as creatures like Subtlety and Endurance that can disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck also has card advantage engines like Shardless Agent and Coiling Oracle to maintain resources. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption while leveraging the synergies between the cards in the deck.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating incremental advantage through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils. By managing the board with Supreme Verdict and Prismatic Ending, it seeks to stabilize the game and eventually win with powerful threats like Solitude. The composition of the deck allows for flexibility in handling various types of threats and adapting to different matchups, making it a versatile and adaptable control archetype in Modern.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing a diverse color palette to maximize its effectiveness. The deck aims to control the board with efficient removal and disruption spells while maintaining a strong offensive presence with powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco. With a mix of versatile spells and land cards that provide various colors of mana, this deck can adapt to different situations and exploit weaknesses in the opponent's defenses.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana through land drops with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor, allowing you to cheat mana costs and accelerate into powerful spells like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. By utilizing the land synergy of Urza's Saga and various utility lands, you can generate overwhelming advantage and potentially win the game in just a few turns. The key strategy is to assemble your combo pieces efficiently and utilize your lands to generate a board state that overwhelms your opponent before they can react effectively.

This deck aims to assemble the Amulet Titan combo quickly by utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to ramp up mana production. Primeval Titan is the key creature to search for with cards like Summoner's Pact and Green Sun's Zenith, allowing for explosive plays. The deck also includes cards like Malevolent Rumble and Scapeshift to control the board and finish off opponents. Urza's Saga is a versatile land that can search for key artifacts, giving the deck additional flexibility and consistency in executing its game plan.

The Amulet Titan deck focuses on using the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands to generate immense amounts of mana quickly, allowing for explosive plays with primeval titan and scapeshift to overwhelm the opponent. Utilizing various lands and utility spells, the deck can search for specific cards and protect its combo pieces while ramping up to game-ending plays. This combo-centric deck aims to quickly assemble its key pieces and win the game before the opponent can effectively respond, capitalizing on the powerful interactions between its cards to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to play powerful combo pieces like Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor. By utilizing land tutors like Urza's Saga and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck can assemble its combo pieces efficiently. The goal is to generate a large amount of mana and either overwhelm the opponent with titans or search up win conditions like Scapeshift. The inclusion of cards like Malevolent Rumble and Aftermath Analyst provides additional utility and disruption to control the game until the combo can be assembled.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to drop big threats, such as Primeval Titan, onto the battlefield. It utilizes cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to cheat out lands and generate extra mana. The deck also includes key pieces like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to support the combo aspect of the deck. With access to cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith, this deck can quickly assemble the pieces needed to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and game-ending combos.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer, Amulet of Vigor, and Explore to cast Primeval Titan and search for utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures. By combining cards like Scapeshift and Lotus Field, the deck can create explosive turns to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Aftermath Analyst and Spelunking helps to draw cards and maintain resources. The deck aims to assemble the Amulet Titan combo efficiently to generate a strong board presence and win the game through overwhelming force and resource advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to efficiently ramp up your mana and quickly assemble the pieces needed to bring out big threats like Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor. Utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Malevolent Rumble, the deck aims to quickly find and play its combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Urza's Saga helps to find key artifacts like Amulet of Vigor, while cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Summoner's Pact provide additional consistency in finding your win conditions. With a mix of ramp and powerful threats, the deck aims to win through explosive plays and overwhelming board presence.

The deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to quickly ramp into powerful lands and threats, allowing for explosive combos and game-winning plays. It also includes cards like Urza's Saga and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With the ability to search for key pieces with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Summoner's Pact, the deck aims to efficiently assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful board presence and strategic plays.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards that can quickly deal damage and control the board, the strategy is to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game. The deck also includes cards that provide protection and utility, helping to secure a victory against various opponents. Additionally, the mana base is built to support the aggressive playstyle while also allowing for flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck embodies a fast-paced and efficient aggro strategy in the Boros color combination.

The deck focuses on generating a large number of tokens through the use of Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker, and then using Blade of the Bloodchief to pump them up. It also includes ways to tutor for important combo pieces like Emrakul, the Promised End and Walking Ballista. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Kozilek's Command and Unholy Heat, while also utilizing Ancient Stirrings to find key cards. The land base includes utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to support the combo strategy.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly using Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga to ramp into powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Walking Ballista. It also utilizes Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to control the board while building up +1/+1 counters with Blade of the Bloodchief. Writhing Chrysalis provides additional creature tokens for sacrifice effects. The deck includes disruption with cards like Pithing Needle and Soul-Guide Lantern, as well as removal with Kozilek's Command and Unholy Heat. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its combo potential and aggressive creatures.

Utilizing a combination of Eldrazi ramp and control elements, this deck aims to accelerate mana production with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. Writhing Chrysalis and Devourer of Destiny provide additional utility in dealing with opposing threats, while Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return offer removal options. Malevolent Rumble serves as a board wipe, clearing the way for your Eldrazi creatures to dominate the battlefield. The deck's goal is to overwhelm opponents with big, powerful creatures while maintaining control of the game.

The main concept of the deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while deploying aggressive threats to quickly close out the game. By combining disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to control the game and pressure the opponent with creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Solitude. Additionally, the deck utilizes flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to gain additional value from creatures like Witch Enchanter and Quantum Riddler, creating a versatile and powerful aggro-control strategy.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It combines interaction spells like Prismatic Ending, Thoughtseize, and Force of Negation with disruptive creatures like Teferi, Time Raveler and Subtlety to control the board. The main win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of evasive creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and powerful card advantage engines like Quantum Riddler and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's resources while steadily building its own advantage to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ulamog using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. Atraxa and Psychic Frog help to control the board while Quantum Riddler and Emperor of Bones provide additional value. Faithful Mending and Consign to Memory help with card draw and graveyard manipulation. Force of Negation protects key pieces, while Prismatic Ending and Thoughtseize provide targeted removal. The deck also includes a variety of fetch lands and shock lands for mana fixing and consistency.

The deck focuses on utilizing instant speed reanimation spells such as Goryo's Vengeance to cheat powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier or Griselbrand into play. This combo is supported by cards like Faithful Mending and Ephemerate to filter through the deck and protect key pieces. Quantum Riddler and Psychic Frog provide additional value by disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes interactive spells like Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats, while Thoughtseize helps disrupt the opponent's strategy. The land base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide flexibility in casting spells.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful Planeswalkers to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It also includes a few powerful win conditions in the form of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, and Thundertrap Trainer, as well as burn spells like Flame of Anor. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, protect its own threats, and then close out the game with its powerful finishers.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Consign to Memory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. Quantum Riddler and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional threats and ways to close out the game quickly. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending to deal with opposing threats, as well as protection and card advantage from cards like Solitude and Ephemerate. The mana base allows for flexibility in casting the various spells in the deck.

The deck focuses on creating a disruptive board presence while pressuring the opponent's resources. It combines aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd with control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Spell Snare to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also features removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to deal with threats efficiently. By utilizing a mix of aggression and disruption, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and secure victory through incremental advantage.

This deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with disruptive spells like Spell Snare and Prismatic Ending while building up a board presence with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. Using efficient removal spells like Solitude and Consign to Memory, the deck can control the battlefield and push for damage quickly. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and tempo advantage, while Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Quantum Riddler offer powerful finishers. The deck also includes a mix of lands to ensure consistent access to mana and colors needed for its spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive elements like Counterspells and Force of Negation to protect key combo pieces like Hydroelectric Specimen and Tameshi, Reality Architect. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win through cards like Goblin Charbelcher or utility lands like Jwari Disruption. The deck is designed to function without requiring traditional land cards, instead focusing on spells and artifacts to advance the game plan. It aims to control the game while setting up the combo for a quick victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and sacrificing them for value to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck is heavily reliant on cheap artifacts like Ornithopter and Memnite to power up cards like Pinnacle Emissary and Thought Monitor. It also includes tools like Mishra's Bauble and Tormod's Crypt to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck contains powerful spells like Metallic Rebuke and Sink into Stupor to control the game and Thoughtcast to draw more cards. Additionally, Urza's Saga is used to tutor for specific artifacts to further enhance the deck's strategy.

The deck focuses on fast mana generation and playing cheap artifacts in conjunction with Urza's Saga to quickly put pressure on the opponent. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruption spells, while also using cards like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt to control the board. The inclusion of Thoughtcast allows for card advantage, ensuring that the deck can maintain its aggressive tempo. Ultimately, the key concept of the deck is to establish an early board presence and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The key idea of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive board presence by using artifact creatures and mana-producing artifacts, supported by disruptive spells to control the opponent's board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and card advantage, while also having the flexibility to disrupt opponent's strategies with cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke. Urza's Saga provides additional value by enabling the deck to search for key artifacts. Overall, the deck is focused on fast, aggressive gameplay with a mix of disruption and card advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering spells, removing threats, and disrupting the opponent's plans. It utilizes cards like Solitude, Force of Negation, and spell snare to control the board and protect its win condition. Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler provide card advantage and tempo advantage, while cards like Supreme Verdict and Wrath of the Skies deal with creature-heavy decks. The deck also includes a companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, which adds an additional layer of control and consistency to the strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Birthing Ritual and casting powerful creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Shardless Agent to apply pressure on the opponent. It also utilizes counterspells like Flare of Denial and Force of Negation to protect its threats. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence through efficient creatures and disruptive spells, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a mix of aggro and control elements.

The key concept of this UR Control deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and bounce effects to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck focuses on maintaining card advantage through cards like Brazen Borrower and Snapcaster Mage, while also applying pressure with efficient threats like Subtlety and Tishana's Tidebinder. By being able to counter key spells, remove threats, and bounce problematic permanents, this deck aims to out value and outlast the opponent until it can close out the game with powerful finishers like Flame of Anor.

Utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and Karn, the Great Creator, this deck aims to control the game through disruption and removal while assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate massive amounts of mana. The deck focuses on utilizing various artifacts and Eldrazi spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy and ultimately overwhelm them with powerful threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging the versatility of Karn, the Great Creator, this deck aims to dominate the late game and secure victory through superior board presence and control.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful Eldrazi creatures and utilizing the UrzaTron lands to ramp up quickly and cast big threats ahead of schedule. The deck includes a mix of removal spells, disruptive creatures, and artifact ramp to establish a strong board presence and shut down opposing strategies. By efficiently utilizing the UrzaTron lands and powerful Eldrazi creatures, the deck aims to overpower opponents and establish dominance in the late game.

The main idea of the deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy using counterspells and removal spells, while also maintaining card advantage through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck aims to play a defensive game, gradually gaining advantage until it can overpower the opponent with powerful spells like Supreme Verdict or Solitude. The inclusion of Isochron Scepter allows for additional utility by imprinting key instants. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana production and to support its multicolored spells.

The focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds an extra layer of synergy to the deck. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to control the board and generate card advantage. With a mix of control elements and card advantage tools, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure a victory through attrition.
